title: Please give us an option to vote to disband lobby so we don't have to dodge.
body:
http://imgur.com/2aq1NI1
http://imgur.com/15D0tYB
http://imgur.com/KhDb40s

First game of the day, first lobby I get into, the Camille says "I'm going to run it down mid, y'all better dodge."

I think he's just messing around, so I wait, he then locks in Camille ADC and I ask him "What is your reasoning for trolling?"

He says "I'm not going to give this support one chance to win." And then an argument breaks out and I learn that they were on the same team last game, and that they don't like each other.

I pretty much didn't care about that game, I sat in base most of the time, or just AFK walked after he intentionally ran it down 4 times, he even bought mob boots.

Please, give us the option to vote to disband a lobby, if 3 people want to disband, it will leave the lobby, I'm sure as hell 3 people would have said yes in that vote, even if Camille troll voted no.

Also, she wasted an extra 5 minutes because her only no vote stopped us from early surrendering, if you're going to put a vote at 15 minutes, make it like the regular vote, where 4 yesses are a surrender.

Every feature like this that you add, there will be a minority that abuses it. If you only act based on that minority, you'll never make any progress

Except this would be abused pretty widely, especially in higher Elo I absolutely guarantee it.  

Imagine after waiting to get into a game for 10-15 minutes, you have to go through another queue because someone vote kicked the guy playing Quinn top.  

I would agree with you that SOME systems would barely be abused and may ultimately be helpful, but this suggestion has far too many possibilities for abuse than it does for good. 

The temptation would be there for someone---especially in their promos---to kick a person that got autofilled as adc.  I like to think of myself as a pretty straight-up individual but that temptation would be there even for me, particularly if I saw someone playing Malz ADC in my promos.

I'm not sure how it's possible to abuse alcohol, drive while drunk and murder a ton of people, yet alcohol and cars are still here.

Hmm, I wonder why.


Oh right, because we care about majority, not minority, it's just LoL, for some reason doing everything opposite than every other goddamn game.

No, the reason we have both alcohol and cars is because there are actual real world consequences for driving while drunk. You get your license suspended. You get put on probation with a 12 step program. Et cetera. 

Getting kicked and/or going back into queue isn't going to dissuade people from repeating behavior like dealing with the police will. We don't have a strong disincentive in place to prohibit repeat toxic behavior, so prevention is a far more preferable solution.

While the argument of alcohol and cars is actually a logical fallacy in regards to this debate, neither can say for a fact that either outcome will happen simply because they haven't been tested. Both are simply a hypothesis, and would have to be tested to actually get an outcome.

I'm for a kick because trolls and inters shouldnt have any power, but with the current dodge system they do. The team should not be punished in order to remove someone like that. 

Yes there is the argument "You could lose 2 lp instead of losing 15-20" but really the core issue with that is someone should HAVE to lose any lp because someone, this camille in this particular case, wants to abhorrently disregard the summoners code

No.
But what about normals?

This is why I have been suggesting to bring back the tribunal.  When 3 or more people report someone in lobby, the lobby is stopped and reset with that person being kicked from queue.  They are free to requeue with no punishment until the case is reviewed by the tribunal.  The tribunal sees an exact recording of the pregame lobby and vote whether the reports were justified.  If they are, that person gets put on low priority queue.  If they are pardoned, anyone who reported gets put on low priority queue.  Every time this happens, someone is punished.  This would prevent the scenarios you described.
then the troll can stop chatting , then pick something like soraka /janna jungle , or something like that

That is a lot less likely to happen because the "troll" in question can't make teammates dodge if the teammates don't see them say "I'm going to run it down mid so you better dodge." This removes the incentive to tell teammates you're going to troll or feed, and if people cannot <attempt to force others to dodge> without getting punished then that behavior will stop as well.

That leaves only trolls who are doing it just to upset others, and players who are going off-meta.

If the person wants to go off-meta they have an obligation to explain that to their teammates. I play off meta all the time. I always talk to my team about it before hand so they know that I'm not trolling. It's not difficult to do, and it works fine that way.

Not communicating about it should be considered punishable, albeit more lightly than taunting in chat would warrant.

Lastly, trolls who decide to act out after the game starts aren't going to be detected during champion select most of the time anyway. If they are going to troll they most certainly won't want their temmates to know in time to escape by dodging, they would rather wait until those teammates are trapped with them for the next 20 minutes. These players will be caught more as the existing punishment and feeder detection system improves.
